item.title: Know What vs Know How
item.description: There’s a difference between know what and know how. There’s a difference between knowing about a thing and knowing how to do a thing. You can learn about cooking without ever really learning how to cook. You can study music without being able to produce it. Our language for each category is not always clear, but we often refer to know what as “knowledge” and know how as “skill”.
